snippet: The use of a Gadsden flag, associated with the Tea Party, at a city armory has prompted a debate on political symbols on city property and the First Amendment.
abstract: Veterans group has filed lawsuit against city of New Rochelle, NY, after officials ordered them to remove flag bearing words Don’t Tread on Me from city-owned armory; officials claim flag has come to symbolize Tea Party and antipathy to government, sparking debate on freedom of speech and city property.
lead_paragraph: The use of a Gadsden flag, associated with the Tea Party, at a city armory has prompted a debate on political symbols on city property and the First Amendment.

headline.main: Veterans Group, Flying a Flag With a Message, Ruffles a City
headline.print_headline: What’s in a Flag? Nothing Political, Veterans Group Says

keywords.value: United Veterans Memorial and Patriotic Association of New Rochelle
keywords.name: organizations
